Reviews.Author: facet_edge

Reviews.Content: Relaxing oasis in a busy city.       View of car park from Hotel porch
Reviews.Author: NRea

Reviews.Content: one of life's disappointments We stayed at this hotel for a week from 22nd September. We chose this hotel as we thought it would be a quiet haven after a hard day's sightseeing and were told it had restaurants near-by, a delightful pool set in its own gardens and was an easy journey into the city centre, so it sounded like an ideal base for a holiday which was relaxing as well as city centred. We were misled. The rooms were clean but basic and the bathroom quite large. Satellite TV means Italian TV plus CNN news. The breakfast is acceptable if you stay for one night, but mundane is the best description as it is the same uninspired selection of sweet croissants, hard rolls, prepacked cheese and luke warm coffee every day, only available until 9.30 at which time the manager takes great delight in putting up his closed sign whilst the waiting staff manage to make you feel as though you are eating in a canteen by clearing tables noisily around you. There is no lounge area and trying to get so much as coffee after 9.30am is impossible. The bar was never open. The pool looked neglected, black on the bottom and set in a scrubby grass area with a few plastic chairs and a couple of recliners. Beware the mosquitos. It was closed for a day when we visited. This hotel is for overnight stays and emphatically NOT for longer. Imagine staying in a Travelodge for a week and you get the idea. It is in a very ordinary suburb and you can find one or two ordinary restaurants within walking distance. At least a 20 minute walk helps the appetite but, like us, you may have imagined the area would have some cafe life nearby. Not so, hunt the pizzeria. The bus stops are a five minute walk away and the bus takes a not very pleasant 25 minutes on a good day, depending on traffic. Taxis cost approx. 12.5 euros depending on the driver. It's a significant additional cost in tiem and money.Staff spoke english and smiled but welcoming would be an exaggeration.I can not recommend this hotel other than for an overnight stay on the way to your next destination. Holiday it isn't.
Reviews.Author: daisykessex

Reviews.Content: Out of town but excellent We stayed two nights at this hotel in September. The directions from the hotel website and Mapquest which we normally use were hopeless so it took us some time to find it. Like a previous review we were also concerned as we seemed to be a long way out of the city but the location is good. We had a car so we drove a short distance to an underground car park and then it was a 15 minute walk into the city.The first room we were allocated was next to the lift so we asked if they had a quieter room and I think we were probably upgraded to a more superior room as it had double aspect windows and was the best room we had on our whole trip. 拢85 a night with Expedia. It was clean and the king size bed was comfy.The breakfast was basic and we did find it difficult not having any other food available in the hotel. There was a buffet served on a Thursday for 8 euros including a drink which was ok but nothing special. On our second night the receptionist directed us to a good pizzeria in the small town which was excellent.The staff were helpful but don't rely on a wake up call if you have a flight to catch as our call was 20 minutes late.We would recommend this hotel for a stay in Florence.
Reviews.Author: Travel2Uk

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel We stayed 2 nights in this hotel in August 2007 - At first, en route in the taxi to this hotel, I was a little surprised at just how far out of Florence this hotel was. It said 3km but it certainly felt longer than 3kms in a taxi (I think it probably is). It cost about 鈧?5 to get there in the taxi from the train station. From the hotel into Florence we had to take buses both ways 鈥?these ran on the half hour and cost 鈧?.10 each way 鈥搚ou can buy bus tickets at the hotel reception. The hotel was very clean and tidy and in the middle of summer, having a pool was a godsend (this was the main reason I chose this hotel). It is not a flash pool but it was great to have somewhere to freshen up in the thick of the heat in the afternoon. The pool was also very clean. The hotel staff were very friendly. The hotel bar is not at all busy. Most of the time we had a drink, we were the only ones in the bar. If you need internet鈥ou won't enjoy the internet experience here 鈥?it's very slow and the computer is possibly off Noah's Ark. All and all I would stay at this hotel again and recommend it to others. I knew the location was out of town and the buses really were not difficult to use. For the sake of a pool, I'd put up with that!
Reviews.Author: Macatravel

Reviews.Content: Great hotel This hotel was really great. The location is slightly outside the centre, probably not walking distance. However there are frequent buses from near the hotel, the no.10/17. The hotel is very quiet and relaxing. The pool was great, however there were only 2 sun loungers that fully reclined.The room was fairly large, as was the bathroom. All the hotel was very clean.The hotel does not have a restaurant and the bar closes at 11pm. However there are a few restaurants within walking distance. The staff were very helpful and polite.I would absolutely recommend this hotel.
Reviews.Author: penguin_0

Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel and great staff       Swimming Pool
Reviews.Author: jrrh101

Reviews.Content: Great hotel and staff I brought a group of seven ladies to this hotel. The staff was very helpful and arranged many things that I asked. The rooms were superb, the service over the top fabulous!!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Stay! Our stay was a surprise, after reading the rewiews!! Tha staff was so helpfull (we had a problem with our luggage and they helped us in any way!!!) and nice.Tha hotel is a standard 4-star with large rooms, good services, clean and situated in a beutiful location (great garden, even not in the historical center).The pool is ok to have a relaxing drink after a walking day!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A great stay Not entirely sure what the reviews before are talking about?This is a great hotel. We stayed here for 150 Euros a night with the 6th and final night being free.The location was exactly what we were looking for - about 5 miles out of Florence but 100 yards from a bus stop that takes you right in to the centre in about 20 minutes. After a long day with the crowds of Florence, coming back to this quiet haven was lovely.We enjoyed the breakfasts (standard Italian fare), the reception staff were very helpful and we had a huge room overlooking the pool, where we spent a couple of days relaxing by.The best place we ate in Florence was Baldovino ([--]) a great value trattoria with amazing food. Try the pizzas and the tuscan bean side dish. Also, the best melon of the trip.
Reviews.Author: welshshrew
